intro: Pedicularis aphyllocaulis, commonly known as the leafless lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. This plant is characterized by its lack of leaves, with photosynthesis occurring through its green stems. It produces striking pink or red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is often found in rocky or open habitats where it can receive adequate sunlight.
